name: gchacg
body: |- wi(w3a(wbr(com, cdom, c0), wcel(c0, cgch), wcel(cpw(c0), cgch)), wcel(cpw(c0), cdm(ccrd)))
bodyPretty: ⊢ ((_om[≼]c0 ∧ c0 ∈ GCH ∧ P(c0)∈ GCH)→ P(c0)∈ dom(card))

stmt.origin: sylancr(w3a(wbr(com, cdom, c0), wcel(c0, cgch), wcel(cpw(c0), cgch)), wcel(cpw(c0), cdm(ccrd)), wcel(cfv(char, c0), con0), wbr(cfv(char, c0), cen, cpw(c0)))

⊣ (((har ` c0)∈ On ∧(har ` c0)[≅]P(c0))→ P(c0)∈ dom(card))

comment: A "local" form of ~ gchac . If ` A ` and ` ~P A ` are GCH-sets, then ` ~P A ` is well-orderable. The proof is due to Specker. Theorem 2.1 of [KanamoriPincus] p. 419. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-May-2015.)
